channel.title: AFL Analysis on Crow Data Science
channel.description: Recent content in AFL Analysis on Crow Data Science

item.title: Can you tell if a players' game is worthy of a brownlow vote?
item.description: Introduction The Brownlow medal, one of the most prestigious AFL awards, is notoriously difficult to predict. You can read this article from Fat Stats for a great look as to why. Here’s a quick summary: Umpires are human and have their own biases Highly predictive stats from last year may not be predictive this year Media influence may impact umpires when they vote Another point that I’d like to throw into the mix:
